SENT.plain: In 68 idiopathic aplastic anemia patients (65 HLA genotypes), HLA-A2 is slightly increased (p corrected less than 0.03) leading to a relative risk of 2.30
A slight excess of homozygotes for HLA-A was observed (22.2 vs. 14.09%), involving mostly the A2 antigen
In the siblings the patients were more frequently homozygote A2 than by chance (p less than 0.005)
The same trends are observed in Fanconi's anemia = out of 18 patients, 7 are HLA-A homozygote (of whom 4 are A2)
The hypothesis of the existence of one or several recessive genes involved in hematopoiesis situated close to HLA-A is advanced
